title: Baby boy diagnosed with cancer alongside identical twin brother dies
text:

A baby boy has lost his fight against cancer after he and his twin brother were both diagnosed with the same devastating illness.

The twins' devoted parents have been left inconsolable with grief after losing the youngest of their identical ten-month-old boys Elijah and Emre on Tuesday.

The brothers were diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia just months after their birth in April and have spent most of their short lives in hospital.

Tragically, a recent bone marrow transplant did not work for little Elijah and he died on Tuesday at 8.30am, reports Examiner Live .

(Image: MEN Media)

(Image: MEN Media)

Nile Liburd, 26, and his partner Nicole Duhaney, 20, had been overjoyed when Elijah, the younger boy by 44 minutes, and Emre, were born just before Christmas last year.

It was a dream come true for Nicole, a first-time mother at 20, who couldn't wait to experience all the joys of motherhood.

But the couple's bliss was shortlived when three weeks later Elijah Liburd began to develop a strange lump on his right cheek.

Their world fell apart in April when both twins were diagnosed with cancer.

(Image: MEN Media)

(Image: MEN Media)

The couple began living full-time with their sick babies at Leeds General Infirmary as doctors began a programme of chemotherapy and radiotherapy treatments.

Now the couple face having to organise Elijah's funeral service at St Barnabas' Church next Tuesday.

Nile's sister-in-law, Bev Liburd, wrote on GoFundMe: "I’m devastated to announce that after his long, courageous, battle, baby Elijah Liburd has lost his battle against leukaemia.

"As you can imagine his mum and dad are broken as are the rest of the family and close ones.

"But as a family we thought it would be a nice idea to raise some money to enable Elijah’s mum and dad to be able to create a memorial of their choice.

(Image: MEN Media)

(Image: MEN Media)

"As well as ensuring that Elijah will have the send off he most definitely deserves. Thanks to everyone in advance for their support and kind words.

"The support has been immense, the support kind words alone are making such a difference. Thank you again so much everyone."

Bev added: "They are both broken, there are no words I can use to describe what they are going through, though Nile has been very strong.

"Neither of them have been home since this started. and we are all very grateful to the Candlelighters charity for helping to ensure this.

"Unfortunately, Elijah's body just wouldn't take the transplant and they didn't want him to suffer anymore and he died on Tuesday."

More than £1,000 has been raised for the family since Elijah' death yesterday.

description: Twin baby boys Elijah and Emre Liburd were diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia just months after their births
